description: College-level calculus-based mechanics problems with rigorous mathematical derivations. Master Newtonian mechanics through advanced problem-solving and prepare for the AP Physics C: Mechanics exam.

topics.name: Unit 1: Kinematics
topics.description: Calculus-based motion analysis, derivatives for velocity and acceleration, integrals for displacement, vector calculus, and parametric equations

topics.name: Unit 2: Newton's Laws
topics.description: Differential equations of motion, variable forces, non-inertial reference frames, drag forces, terminal velocity, and advanced force analysis

topics.name: Unit 3: Work, Energy & Power
topics.description: Line integrals for work, conservative and non-conservative forces, potential energy functions, energy methods, and power as dE/dt

topics.name: Unit 4: Systems of Particles & Momentum
topics.description: Center of mass calculations with integrals, momentum conservation in continuous systems, variable mass problems, impulse integrals, and rocket equation

topics.name: Unit 5: Rotation
topics.description: Rotational kinematics with calculus, moment of inertia by integration, parallel axis theorem, torque and angular momentum, rotational dynamics, and rolling motion

topics.name: Unit 6: Oscillations
topics.description: Simple harmonic motion differential equations, damped oscillations, forced oscillations, resonance, energy in SHM, and coupled oscillators

topics.name: Unit 7: Gravitation
topics.description: Newton's law of gravitation, gravitational potential energy, orbital mechanics, Kepler's laws derivation, escape velocity, and gravitational field theory

topics.name: Unit 8: Revision & Exam Prep
topics.description: Comprehensive multi-concept problems, AP-style free response questions, calculus-intensive derivations, and exam strategies
